result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryon Anthony Schleh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for Probation on 10/11/22 by 03:00 PM
- 15 days credit against ultimate sentence
- Eligible for expungement if successfully completes probation

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
- $268.00 Court Costs, payable through DOC as a condition of Probation in case 22CF419 Count 1
- $250.00 DNA Surcharge, payable through DOC as a condition of Probation in case 22CF419 Count 1

- $686.91 Restitution, payable to New Richmond Walmart, payable through DOC as a condition of Probation in case 22CF419 Count 1
-Repayment rate of $30.00 per month towards restitution commencing 11/01/22

- DNA Sample
- No Contact with Walmart in New Richmond, WI
- Maintain Full-time Employment or School

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryon Anthony Schleh

11:42 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Travis Satorius for  Abrianna Dolfi in court for Bryon Anthony Schleh. Defendant Bryon Anthony Schleh in court. ADA Ellenwood recites agreement. DE sworn. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - Retail Theft w/ modifier. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - Retail Theft w/ modifier. Sentencing recommendations. Court orders repayment plan of$30 per month towards restitution commencing 11/1, to be paid through probation. Court sets Restitution Hearing. Court discusses expungement, Court will consider if DE completes all conditions of probation including payments. Defendant advised of appeal rights. 

Court orders: 
Ct 1 - Retail Theft w/ modifier
S/W 2 years probation with conditions:
- 60 days conditional jail STAYED
- No contact with Walmart in New Richmond, WI 
- Maintain full-time employment or school
- Restitution $686.91, payable to New Richmond Walmart; payable through DOC
- Court Costs $268; payable through DOC
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $250; payable through DOC

15 days jail credit.
Defendant to report to probation no later than 3:00 PM today, 10/11/22.
Adjourned: 12:03 PM. kma
Restitution hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Restitution hearing on December 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Pretrial bond report. Filed by JSC Shelby H.   to kp

9:53 AM  Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: Yates.  Defendant Bryon Anthony Schleh appeared by video.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Bryon Anthony Schleh.  Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds waiver of personal appearance. Arraignment: not guilty plea; waives further reading, no speedy trial demand. Court confirms DE address. Court advises DE to appear in person for 9/29/22 PTC. Adjourned: 9:55 a.m.
Filed by DDA Ellenwood. km
Filed by ADA Becker. km

AMENDED

Defendant to sign pre-signed waiver of extradition.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Walmart in New Richmond WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant to report to Justice Support Center immediately after release. 
I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to contact the Justice Support Center at least on time per week to verify address.

2:34 PM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: Yates. Attorney Michael Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bryon Anthony Schleh in court, in custody.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Bryon Anthony Schleh. Atty Dolfi requests waiver, requests bond modification to signature bond. Atty Becker objects to bond request. Court amends bond. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Adjourned: 2:43 p.m.
Arraignment scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Arraignment on August 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.
